Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= process by which humans or objects come upon (other) humans or objects without searching
= one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which a countable entity is eight in number
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= water that has fallen as rain

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= a cardinal direction to the right of a person facing the sunrise
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
literally: filled; hence: = state in which a woman is with child
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= referent to an unknown or not yet identified location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= process by which an activity achieves its intended results
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which an event is experienced as pleasing

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= state in which humans are still relatively young
literally: (one's) heart makes (someone) good; hence: = causative process by which one's thinking and choices bring about enjoyment
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
= state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their heart (לֵב) ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person
= state in which humans are still relatively young
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
